body:
<!-- Please use this template while reporting a bug and provide as much info as possible. Not doing so may result in your bug not being addressed in a timely manner. Thanks!

If the matter is security related, please disclose it privately via https://kubernetes.io/security/
-->


**What happened**: tried to get listing of all componentstatuses using a labelSelector query selector. I am hitting the apiServer directly. GET /api/v1/componentstatuses

**What you expected to happen**: GET /api/v1/componentstatuses with labelSelector should limit responses to only componentstatuses with the specified label

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**: run GET /api/v1/componentstatuses with and without a labelSelector against the apiServer.

**Anything else we need to know?**: specifically my label selector is in the form `mylabel=myvalue`. and i can confirm everything works as expected when i hit GET /api/v1/pods

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`): Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"13", GitVersion:"v1.13.6+IKS", GitCommit:"ac5f7341d5d0ce8ea8f206ba5b030dc9e9d4cc97", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-05-09T13:26:51Z", GoVersion:"go1.11.5", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration: IBM
- OS (e.g: `cat /etc/os-release`): Mac
- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`): Darwin Kernel Version 18.5.0
- Install tools: Using javascript npm request to talk to api server
- Network plugin and version (if this is a network-related bug):
- Others:

title: GET /api/v1/componentstatuses does not respect labelSelector
